## Placeholder

Firstly, let set up an empty golang project without any dependency.

```go.mod
module github.com/toniphan21/go-mapper-gen/example

go 1.25
```

### Concat {CurrentPackage}

We can concat the placeholder if source package is a subpackage of current package
```pkl
packages {
  ["github.com/toniphan21/go-mapper-gen/example"] {
    source_pkg = "{CurrentPackage}/db"
    
    structs {
      ["User"] { source_struct_name = "UserEntity" }
    }
  }
}
```

```go
// file: entity.go

package example

type User struct {
	ID        string
	Email     string
}

```
```go
// file: db/entity.go

package db

type UserEntity struct {
	ID        string
	Email     string
}
```

the output should be

```go
// golden-file: gen_mapper.go
// Code generated by github.com/toniphan21/go-mapper-gen - test, DO NOT EDIT.

package example

import db "github.com/toniphan21/go-mapper-gen/example/db"

type iMapper interface {
	// ToUser converts a db.UserEntity value into a User value.
	ToUser(in db.UserEntity) User

	// FromUser converts a User value into a db.UserEntity value.
	FromUser(in User) db.UserEntity
}

func new_iMapper() iMapper {
	return &iMapperImpl{}
}

type iMapperImpl struct{}

func (m *iMapperImpl) ToUser(in db.UserEntity) User {
	var out User

	out.ID = in.ID
	out.Email = in.Email

	return out
}

func (m *iMapperImpl) FromUser(in User) db.UserEntity {
	var out db.UserEntity

	out.ID = in.ID
	out.Email = in.Email

	return out
}

var _ iMapper = (*iMapperImpl)(nil)
```
